channel.title: Server general discussion
channel.description:
Make the section so posts have to be approved by a moderator before appearing, there's not a huge amount of discussion going on and I'm sick of wading though 10+ locked topics because idiots both can't read the rules and don't care about them.
I know this would require work on the moderators' parts, but it would also save the time of getting 3-4 reports a topic just so someone could come in and lock it. It also isn't that hard to just ignore the stupid 'phr33 hosting' topics, just leave them there and approve any actual discussion topics. Plus it's not like it's a super vital board or anything either, they could just check it whenever they have the time to get on (so maybe 1-2 times a day) to see if there are any good posts.
Then again, I'm not sure if it's worse to have the board and reports spammed or to have to check the board every now and then.

item.title: Server general discussion
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

While I don’t particularly mind approving topics in the section, I think there are better alternatives that could also suit the rest of the forum as a whole. I was actually thinking about this earlier and I think a better alternative would be to give moderators the power to ‘hide’ forum posts/threads from the community. It’s not as bad as deleting them really, but I think it should only be used in certain situations where locked topics clutter up a board (such as this situation).

I would of posted this idea in the staff section normally, but it ties in with your suggestion so I see no harm in it.

Read full topic
